definition: first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

sentences.english: Now, the Hulks has got its gentleman again, through me.
sentences.chinese: 现在监狱船又经过我的手把这个正人君子请回了。

sentences.english: He's a gentleman, if you please, this villain.
sentences.chinese: 像这样一个混蛋还装什么正人君子？

sentences.english: He looks as if a gentleman.
sentences.chinese: 他表面看上去是个正人君子。

sentences.english: My father is always criticizing me for being unorganized, but I feel that people in glass houses should not throw stone.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲总是批评我没有条理，但是我想正人先正己。

sentences.english: His demeanour has always been that of a perfect gentleman.
sentences.chinese: 他的举止始终是属于正人君子的模样。

sentences.english: Looking ahead, the Top Gun with sea Masato confidence.
sentences.chinese: 展望未来，壮志凌云的海正人信心满怀。

sentences.english: A mensch is someone who is a refined and sensitive person.
sentences.chinese: 正人君子意味着一个人的高尚和感性。

sentences.english: He looked every inch a gentleman.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去完全是正人君子。

sentences.english: Learn boxing to Germany first, respectful humility, not competing with the recipe for an honest man.
sentences.chinese: 学拳以德为先，恭敬谦逊，不与人争，方为正人君子。

sentences.english: Thanksgiving slander you, is that they let you know sweep before your own door.
sentences.chinese: 感恩污蔑你的人，是他们让你知道正人先正己。

sentences.english: And being the gentleman He is, I believe He has calmly backed out.
sentences.chinese: 神是正人君子，我相信祂就静静地站到一旁。

definition: to have a sense of shame
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
to preserve a proper behavior in private life
people of good will (idiom); charitable person
